intro: Galium antitauricum, commonly known as the Tauric bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Galium antitauricum is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It is a perennial herb that grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters.
